description: Sum_{ d divides n, d=1 mod 4} d - Sum_{ d divides n, d=3 mod 4} d.
comments: Multiplicative because it is the Inverse Moebius transform of [1 0 -3 0 5 0 -7 ...], which is multiplicative. - _Christian G. Bower_, May 18 2005
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(p^e)=1 if p=2, a(p^e)=(p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1) if p == 1 (mod 4), a(p^e)=((-p)^(e+1)-1)/(-p-1) if p == 3 (mod 4). - _Michael Somos_, May 29 2005
prog: (PARI) {a(n)=local(A,p,e); if(n<1, 0, A=factor(n); prod(k=1,matsize(A)[1], if(p=A[k,1], e=A[k,2]; if(p==2, 1, p*=kronecker(-4,p); (p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1)))))} /* _Michael Somos_, May 29 2005 */(PARI) {a(n)=if(n<1, 0, sumdiv(n, d, kronecker(-4, d)*d))} /* _Michael Somos_, May 29 2005 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 23 1999
